subject: Parenting
title: Children in the Factories
description: A short lesson to help you apply Children in the Factories.

hook.text: In 1833 England, children as young as five worked 16-hour shifts in cotton mills.

buildup.text: The Industrial Revolution pulled millions of children from farms into factories.

discovery.text: Small hands were valued for threading machines. Small bodies fit in tight mine shafts.

climax.text: Public outrage eventually led to the Factory Acts â€” the first laws protecting children from labor.

punchline.text: Children's rights began not from philosophy, but from the horror of factories.

quiz.question: What led to the first child labor protection laws in England?
options: Public outrage over factory conditions for children
